In that day. In the day of the Lord, meaning the time of the Lord's second coming (see 2:12).

great and strong sword. At his second coming, Jesus Christ will use his sword to wage war against Satan (see commentary on 34:5).

leviathan/fleeing serpent/crooked serpent/dragon. These terms refer to Satan. The meaning of leviathan is uncertain. Elsewhere Satan is identified as "serpent" and "dragon" (51:9; 2 Ne. 2:18)—terms that describe his nature. Fleeing may also be understood as swift, while crooked suggests deception or treachery. Both are valid descriptions of the adversary, who must be conquered in order for the Lord's vineyard to be safe and for Zion to be fully established. The Lord will accomplish this at the beginning of his millennial reign (Rev. 20:1-2).

sea. The "destroyer rideth upon the face" of the waters (D&C 61:19).
